case.state: Alright, time to play some strip poker and... who are you people?

...Yep. I'm as ordinary as it gets. (Is she one of those Touhous? I think she's a Touhou.)

condition.saying: You fascinate me in your plainness, Young Nanoko. At least ~player~ has the good sense to say as little as possible.

case.state: I don't know if I should take that as an insult or not, but, if I fascinate you that much, I could rattle off some facts about myself...

condition.saying: Young Nanoko, as for your future plans: what hope you to accomplish with what little time your mortal body gives you?

case.state: Hmm... well, I know I want to go to university.
It's no... hey! I'm not a peasant! Rude!

It's my stockings or my sweater now...

Well, a promise is a promise...

condition.saying: That is odd. I’ve grown accustomed to Gensokyo’s magical beings as my bedfellows. All the humans I know are magicians and shrine maidens.

case.state: That's... interesting? I'm no shrine maiden or magician, I just work part-time at my dad's video game store.

condition.saying: Perhaps this is a good idea to get to understand the common people better. To understand their hopes and concerns, so I might yet further improve myself as a leader.

case.state: My full name is Nanoko Sakura, I'm 18, I live in America but my parents both came from Japan, I'm in my final year of high school, my dad taught me how to repair video game consoles which inspired me to major in engineering once I graduate, my favorite anime is Jojo's Bizarre Adventure (mostly Stardust Crusaders), I'm allergic to seafood but not enough that it'll kill me, I have 300 hours logged on Animal Crossing: New Horizons and my island finally reached five stars yesterday, I had an extra tooth growing out of the roof of my mouth that I had to have extracted when I was two, I want to learn how to speedrun Donkey Kong 64, I've never broken a bone so I'm probably immune, I hate when people send bug reports for things that are intentional, I have an older sister and a niece...

condition.saying: What is your family’s line of work? Are you rice farmers? Fishermen? Those are peasant sort of jobs, yes?

case.state: My dad goes fishing with my uncle every Saturday during the summer, but it's not his job. He runs a video game store, and my mom works at a pet parlor.

condition.saying: Young Sumireko oft tells of a place known as “University” that has abolished the use of rest and sleep. She intends to be exiled to there.

case.state: Yeah, there! It's pretty expensive to go to university, so I'm saving up money working at my dad's store and babysitting for my sister.

condition.saying: I had been worried that because Buddhism had fallen out of favor in Japan, the populace would not be sufficiently mollified.

case.state: Uh, well...
(I'm really stripping in front of all these characters... what if they think I'm annoying? What if they think I'm stupid?)
(C'mon, Nanoko! This is the third time you've taken something small off! All of these cool people are gonna think you suck!)
If you're trying to stare up my skirt, you're out of luck. My school makes all of the girls wear shorts because people can't control themselves...
(Alright, this is your big anime badass moment! This is you taking off your training weights! You're gonna blow all these legends away!)
(Okay, calm down. What would a Joestar do in this situation? They'd probably keep a level head and try to throw the enemy off... wait.)
That's right, everyone! Bottomless first! Nanoko-chan doesn't play by your rules!

condition.saying: My interactions with the human village’s citizens are mostly limited to speeches and official business. Being with a… normal person in so intimate a setting is new to me.

case.state: If that's the case, I'll teach you everything you need to know about us "normal" folk! Ask me anything!

condition.saying: Yes. Mmhmm. I see. Alright, I’m bored now. Thank you for your time, Young Nanoko.

case.state: ...I wasn't done.

condition.saying: Wait, Young Sumireko tells me the serfs of the modern world all work in “IT Support.” How well supported are the ITs of your family?

case.state: That's... not what that means.

condition.saying: I’m glad. For society to function, the common-folk must strive to be hard-working, contributing, and sufficiently pacified.

case.state: (Even if I do keep accidentally spending all of my money on figures...)

condition.saying: However, I needn’t fear. It seems in the modern world, religion has been replaced by that which you call “anime”. I thank you for your cooperation, Young Nanoko.

case.state: ...I think we need to talk after we're done here.

condition.saying: Oh dear, are you so poor you’ve been forced to sell the hair around your privates? If ever you have money problems, I’d be glad to lend any amount.
